glsa.title: PDFjam: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in the PDFjam scripts allow for local privilege escalation.

background.p: PDFjam is a small collection of shell scripts to edit PDF documents, including pdfnup, pdfjoin and pdf90.

ul.li: Martin Vaeth reported multiple untrusted search path vulnerabilities (CVE-2008-5843).
Marcus Meissner of the SUSE Security Team reported that temporary files are created with a predictable name (CVE-2008-5743).

impact.p: A local attacker could place a specially crafted Python module in the current working directory or the /var/tmp directory, and entice a user to run the PDFjam scripts, leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A local attacker could also leverage symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
